intro: Erechtites argutus, commonly known as the rough hawksbeard, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and distinctive leaf morphology. The plant features rough, hairy leaves that are typically lance-shaped and have a serrated edge. It produces yellow flowers that bloom in the summer, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Erechtites argutus is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including roadsides and meadows.
